Questions: find 5th highest salary in different way? (2 ways)
Answers: select salary from(select salary, row_number() over (order by salary desc) AS rn from  employees) ranked_salary where rn = 5  select distinct salary from(select salary, dense_rank() over (order by salary desc) as rnk from  employee) where rnk = 5

Questions: Why View performance is slow? What we should do to increase the performance of the view.
Answers: Views are slow because of complex logics and joins .We can make faster by using indexing and partitioning

how to find if a column has an index or not ?
Answers: select sal_index from user_ind_columns where table_name = 'employees' and column_name = 'salary'
Corrected Answer: Select index_name from all_indexes where table_name = 'table_name'

Questions: Write a query where you use case statement
Answers: select emp_name, case when gender = 'F' then 'Femalle' when gender = 'M' then 'Male' when gender = 'U' then 'Unknown' end as gender from employees

Questions: webvisit visit_id site 100      www.google.com 101      www.facebook.com 100      www.google.com  Delete the duplicate records in webvisit table
Answers: delete from webvisit where rowed not in(select max(rowid) from webvitis group by visit_id)

Questions: Why union query runs slower (usually) compared to union all queries
Answers: because of duplicate elimination union is slower

Questions: What does implicit cursor mean in the database world?
Answers: Cursor which are created by oracle itself while executing certain statement inside function or procedure is called implicit cursor

Questions: What is the difference between synonyms and views?
Answers: a view is a logical table where synonym is is a alternative name
Corrected Answer: A view is a virtual table based on select query combined of one or multiple table. A synonym is a alias for database object like tables,views and sequences

I have 2 emp tables with 5 records each. Name like emp1 and emp2. Now i delete the emp1 records and truncate the emp2 records after that I rollback this transaction. How many rows you will have in emp1 and emp2
Corrected Answer: Emp 1 records will be rolledback .Emp2 records will have  no records because truncate option cannot be rolled back

I have an dept table .In that dept table I have columns like deptno with primary key and dname with unique key. After that I insert vaue like this (insert into dept values(10," " ); insert into dept values(20," " );), Does it allows null values second time ?
Corrected Answer: In oracle we can insert multiple null values when a column has unique constraint
